worklogs.comment:
liyafan82 commented on pull request #4602: ARROW-5639: [Java] Remove floating point computation from BaseVariableWidthVector#getOffsetBufferValueCapacity
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4602
 
 
   Method BaseVariableWidthVector#getOffsetBufferValueCapacity uses floating point computation to calculate the capacity, which is not necessary.
   
   (int) ((offsetBuffer.capacity() * 1.0) / OFFSET_WIDTH);
   
   It is interesting to note that JIT cannot optimize away the floating point computations:
   
   So this has performance penalty:
   Before:
   VariableWidthVectorBenchmarks.getValueCapacity avgt 5 6.570 ± 0.004 ns/op
   
   After:
   VariableWidthVectorBenchmarks.getValueCapacity avgt 5 5.787 ± 0.575 ns/op
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

liyafan82 commented on issue #4602: ARROW-5639: [Java] Remove floating point computation from BaseVariableWidthVector#getOffsetBufferValueCapacity
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4602#issuecomment-503459841
 
 
   > Method BaseVariableWidthVector#getOffsetBufferValueCapacity uses floating point computation to calculate the capacity, which is not necessary.
   > 
   > (int) ((offsetBuffer.capacity() * 1.0) / OFFSET_WIDTH);
   > 
   > It is interesting to note that JIT cannot optimize away the floating point computations:
   > 
   > So this has performance penalty:
   > Before:
   > VariableWidthVectorBenchmarks.getValueCapacity avgt 5 6.570 ± 0.004 ns/op
   > 
   > After:
   > VariableWidthVectorBenchmarks.getValueCapacity avgt 5 5.787 ± 0.575 ns/op
   
   Sure. 
   
   > @liyafan82 thank you for the cleanup. It looks like there are a few other places that might benefit as well:
   > 
   > java//vector/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/vector/BaseFixedWidthVector.java: return (int) ((valueBuffer.capacity() * 1.0) / typeWidth);
   > java//vector/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/vector/BaseVariableWidthVector.java: return (int) ((offsetBuffer.capacity() * 1.0) / OFFSET_WIDTH);
   > java//vector/src/main/java/org/apache/arrow/vector/complex/BaseRepeatedValueVector.java: return (int) ((offsetBuffer.capacity() * 1.0) / OFFSET_WIDTH);
   > java//vector/target/classes/codegen/templates/UnionVector.java: return (int) ((typeBuffer.capacity() * 1.0) / TYPE_WIDTH);
   > 
   > Do you want to clean those up as part of this PR as well?
   
   Sure. Thank you so much for the kind reminder.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
Some getOffsetBufferValueCapacity methods uses floating point computation to calculate the capacity, which is not necessary.

(int) ((offsetBuffer.capacity() * 1.0) / OFFSET_WIDTH);

It is interesting to note that JIT cannot optimize away the floating point computations:

 !image-2019-06-18-20-30-17-826.png! 

So this has performance penalty:
Before:
VariableWidthVectorBenchmarks.getValueCapacity  avgt    5  6.570 ± 0.004  ns/op

After:
VariableWidthVectorBenchmarks.getValueCapacity  avgt    5  5.787 ± 0.575  ns/op
fields.summary: [Java] Remove floating point computation from getOffsetBufferValueCapacity
